commentary.text: $$5.50pm$$  In come the players. Robin Uthappa and Gautam Gambhir to open for KKR. Sandeep Sharma has the new ball for Punjab.
Reetam: "KKR bowled really well I think. Take out Viru's 72 of 50 , rest of KXIP 77 of 70 !!! Maxi, Miller, Bailey all kept quiet .."
Umm Abeeha: "KKRs substitutions Morkel n Chawla between them have taken 5 wickets for 39 runs off 8 overs...master stroke ??? So far Yes..wait n see if the batting will miss Shakib..."
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa,no run,bit of inswing from outside off. Uthappa drives to mid-off.
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa,no run,inswing again, lots of it, and Uthappa is beaten on the inside as he swishes his bat down with that KP-style curtain-rail batswing.
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa,1 run,pushes to mid-off and sets off quickly for one.
Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir,1 run,swings away from Gambhir, but he flicks it solidly, playing outside the line, in front of midwicket.
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa,no run,goes the other way this time, and Uthappa is on the walk as he is beaten outside off.
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa,no run,slight inswing. Uthappa pushes it towards midwicket.
Mitch has had a quiet IPL so far. How will he go here?
Johnson to Gambhir,1 run,flicked to the left of mid-on from outside off.
Johnson to Uthappa,2 leg byes,short, outside leg, and Uthappa gets a little tickle on it down to fine leg.
Johnson to Uthappa,1 run,bit of inswing from back of a length. Uthappa stays back, plays late, pushes it into the off side.
Johnson to Gambhir,no run,straightens from middle and off. Hits the outside half of Gambhir's bat, but he plays it safely down into the off side.
Johnson to Gambhir,no run,short, outside off, Gambhir is beaten on the pull.
Johnson to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,similar delivery, different result. He gets hold of it and sends it over the leg side and rolling beyond the vacant midwicket boundary.
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,drifts onto the pads, and Uthappa flicks it sweetly, sends it hurtling away to the left of deep square leg, who has no chance.
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa,no run,wide outswinger, Uthappa pushes forward and is beaten on the drive.
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,down the track, gets to the pitch, and places it beautifully with a straight bat to the left of wide mid-off.
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa,no run,length ball, outside off. Uthappa is across to defend it to mid-on.
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,bit of away swing, but Robin shows the full face and times that straight push exquisitely past the bowler.
Saha comes up to the stumps now.
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa,no run,full, outside off, solid drive to mid-off.
Johnson to Gambhir,1 run,full and wide, and Gambhir slices it uppishly but wide of point.
Johnson to Uthappa, $$SIX$$ ,It's short, and Uthappa top-edges his pull way over third man.
Johnson to Uthappa,no run,angled across the right-hander, checked push to cover.
Johnson to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,length ball, room outside off, and Uthappa swings his arms through to flat-bat it into the gap between the bowler and mid-off.
Johnson to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,drifts down the leg side now, and Uthappa glances it neatly to the left of a diving wicketkeeper.
Johnson to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,full, on leg-and-middle, and Uthappa flicks it nonchalantly square on the leg side. Mitch was holding the ball cross-seam as he ran in.
Munaf : "Anyone else see shades of Ian Bell in Robin Uthappa? Seems to strike the ball so effortlessly." Strange comparison, normally, but there's something to it today.
Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir,no run,superb stop from Mandeep, diving to his right at point to cut off this firm front-foot push from Gambhir.
Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir,no run,down the track, doesn't get hold of this slower ball outside off. Trickles into the off side.
Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,short, angling across, Gambhir pulls it high, drops just short of the rope and rolls into it slowly.
Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir,no run,angled across, looks to give himself room and guide it behind point. Finds the fielder.
Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir,1 wide,short ball, banged into the crease, Gambhir pulls away from it and it loops down into Saha's gloves.

Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir,2 runs,length ball on off, Gambhir tries to give himself room but doesn't manage to find too much of it. His slash goes uppishly and drops just out of reach of a diving Mandeep at cover point.
Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir,no run,punched off the back foot, straight to a deepish cover point.
Akshar Patel now.
Patel to Uthappa,no run,length ball, angled into the stumps, Uthappa reverse-sweeps straight to point.
Patel to Uthappa,no run,tries to make room, but it skids on. Knocks it down into the off side.
Patel to Uthappa,no run,bit of bounce, and the attempted reverse-sweep ends up in the batsman gloving the ball into his helmet.
Patel to Uthappa,2 runs,Awana misfields this cut at point. It was hit straight to him, not particularly hard.
Patel to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,down the track, chipped cleverly over mid-on, who has no chance of cutting it off running back.
Patel to Uthappa,1 run,driven with a straight bat to mid-on.
Raghu: "It is wonderful to watch local Indian Batsmen taking on Johnson, Morkel & Steyn, but when they play out side sub-continent would struggle to get bat on ball in good Good old Test Cricket."
Parvinder Awana comes on now.
Awana to Uthappa,2 runs,full, on off, flicked neatly to midwicket's left.
Awana to Uthappa,1 wide,angled way down the leg side
Awana to Uthappa, $$FOUR$$ ,straightens a bit from outside off, and Uthappa gets a thick edge down to the third man boundary.
Awana to Uthappa,1 run,full, drifts onto leg stump, but deep square leg is there to cut off the flick.
Awana to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,short, bit of width, and Gambhir plays that favourite slash of his past a diving backward point.
Awana to Gambhir,1 run,dabs it down to third man with an open bat face.

Awana to Uthappa, $$OUT$$ ,he timed that too well! Awana drifts onto the pads again, and Uthappa picks it up and hits it over the leg side, Akshar runs to his left to take a good catch at deep midwicket.
Looks like they've taken a time-out. Manish Pandey replaces his Karnataka teammate. He'll face Rishi Dhawan.
harshahossur: "Crowd chanting KKR KKR. What a home crowd for Punjab."
Dhawan to Pandey,no run,Wide outside off, full, lets it go.
Dhawan to Pandey,1 run,angled in towards off stump, comes forward and opens his face to steer it to deep point.
Dhawan to Gambhir,1 run,fullish, angled across Gambhir, who steers it to deep point.
Dhawan to Pandey,1 run,shortish, on leg stump, swatted away to deep backward square leg.
Dhawan to Gambhir,1 run,waits on it and chops it down to third man.
Dhawan to Pandey,no run,length ball, angling into off stump, pushed to cover.
Sudipta: "@harshahossur, actually they are the home crowd for KKR for their next match. Guess they are practicing for that. "
Awana to Gambhir,1 run,It's close to off stump, and Gambhir gives himself a bit of room to chop it to third man.
Awana to Pandey,no run,bit of movement away, Pandey comes down the track and is beaten on the poke.
Awana to Pandey,no run,hugs that off-stump line, and Pandey pushes it awkwardly back to the bowler.

Awana to Pandey,1 run,tries to steer this past point. Bounces up and Maxwell fields it well, stretching his arms high above his head. Misses the throw at the bowler's end. Gambhir would have been miles out.
Awana to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,cut hard, to the right of point and to the left of a helplessly sprinting third man.
Awana to Gambhir,1 run,banged in, angled across from wide of the crease. Gambhir leans back to make room and chops down on it to hit it to third man.
Dhawan to Gambhir,1 run,slower ball, outside leg, clipped to deep square leg.
Dhawan to Pandey,1 run,slower ball, pushed down to long-on.
Dhawan to Gambhir,1 run,ball stops on Gambhir, and the leading edge pops into the off side, nowhere near Miller at cover.
Dhawan to Pandey, $$FOUR$$ ,swatted away from well outside off over midwicket.
Dhawan to Pandey,2 runs,goes over the same fielder, this time with the flick, and deep square leg runs around and cuts it down to two.
Dhawan to Pandey,1 run,flicked towards midwicket from outside off.
At this stage, Punjab were 85 for 2. But they fell away after that. How will Kolkata go? Here's Akshar, with 'Axar' on his shirt.
Patel to Pandey,no run,goes with the angle, and Pandey jumps up and jams his bat down on it.
Patel to Pandey,no run,pushed to mid on.
Patel to Pandey,1 run,stops on him a bit, pushed uppishly to long-off.
left-arm over to Gambhir
Patel to Gambhir,no run,shortish, wide, cuts and misses.
Patel to Gambhir,1 run,gives himself room to cut it to deep point.
Patel to Pandey,no run,ball goes with the angle from outside off, defensive push towards the covers.
Maxwell comes on now.
Maxwell to Gambhir,2 runs,gives himself room, chops it towards deep point.
Maxwell to Gambhir,2 runs,lifts this over cover, long-off runs to his right and cuts it off short of the rope.
Maxwell to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,not that short, not that wide, but Gambhir is back in his crease to cut it to the right of backward point.
Maxwell to Gambhir,1 wide,slips down the leg side trying to compensate.
Maxwell's bowling around the wicket to Gambhir.
Maxwell to Gambhir,1 run,worked towards deep midwicket.
Stays around to Pandey.
Maxwell to Pandey,no run,tosses it wide of off stump. Comes forward to drive it to cover.
Maxwell to Pandey,1 run,down the leg side this time, worked behind square leg.
Here comes Mitch now. KKR need 48 from 48.
Johnson to Pandey,no run,back of a length, tight on off stump, Pandey stays beside the line but can only push it to cover.
Johnson to Pandey,2 runs,short, outside off, Pandey clears his front leg and pulls towards deep midwicket, where Akshar makes a diving stop.
Kuldeep: "For all you non-Hindi speaking fans, Axar (Aksar) means Often versus his actual name Akshar, which means Alphabet in Hindi."
Johnson to Pandey, $$FOUR$$ ,what a shot that is. Gets his front leg out of the way, stands up and punches it with a straight bat back past the bowler.
Johnson to Pandey,1 run,clears his front leg again and swipes to deep square leg. It wasn't short enough to pull.
Johnson to Gambhir,no run,tries to flick this slower ball that is headed down leg, and is hit on the front pad instead.
Johnson to Gambhir,1 run,another slower ball. Gambhir bunts it down into the leg side.
Patel to Gambhir,1 run,cut straight to backward point, who is right back on the circle.
Patel to Pandey,no run,lovely. tossed up, and Pandey is nowhere near the pitch as he prods forward outside off. Ball turns away and beats him.
Patel to Pandey,1 run,pushed towards cover, where Bailey makes a diving stop to his left.
Patel to Gambhir,no run,tries to cut - the width is there but he's beaten.
Patel to Gambhir,no run,this one's closer to off stump and he tries to cut again and misses again.
Patel to Gambhir,1 run,clears his front leg and swipes it to deep midwicket.
Ranjan: "Bailey needs to step aside for Shaun Marsh and Shivam needs to be brought back"
On comes Dhawan once again.
Dhawan to Gambhir,1 run,gives himself room, slaps it to mid-off.
Dhawan to Pandey,1 run,straight, full, flicked to deep midwicket.
Tom: "Interesting that 'akshar' is alphabet in Hindi. 'Aksara' is the word for alphabet in Malay & Javanese. Must come from the same Sanskrit root." Lots of debate around his name now.
Dhawan to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,short, sits up, and Gambhir's pulled it, one bounce over the rope between long on and deep midwicket.
Dhawan to Gambhir,1 run,slower ball, Gambhir clips it to deep midwicket.

Dhawan to Pandey,2 runs,another slower legcutter, and Pandey opens his face to guide it to Mandeep's right at point. He dives, the ball ricochets off his right hand and the sweeper throws to the bowler's end. There was a bit of hesitation, but Dhawan missed the throw and disturbed the bails with his hands instead.
Dhawan to Pandey,1 run,length ball on leg stump, worked away into the on side.
They've taken a time-out now. Gambhir's three short of a half-century. Here comes Akshar now.
Patel to Pandey,no run,shortish ball, angled in, Pandey is deep in his crease to punch to mid off.
Patel to Pandey,no run,Gambhir set off as soon as Pandey pushed that to cover, even though it went straight to Bailey, but Akshar didn't collect his throw cleanly.
Patel to Pandey,1 run,pulled down to long-on
Patel to Gambhir,2 runs,down the track, chips it to deep midwicket.
Patel to Gambhir, $$FOUR$$ ,short, wide, rubbish ball, and Gambhir's punch sends it soaring over cover and well away from a sprinting long-off. Gambhir raises his bat. Third fifty of the season.
Patel to Gambhir,1 run,works it down to wide long on.

Dhawan to Gambhir,2 runs,worked towards long-on, and the batsmen aren't running too quickly. Mitch picks it up and releases quickly. They go to the third umpire for the direct hit at the bowler's end but Pandey is safe.
Dhawan to Gambhir,1 run,slower ball, fullish, on off. Gambhir swipes it to long-on.
Dhawan to Pandey,1 run,another slower ball, onto the pads, tucked away to deep backward square.
Dhawan to Gambhir,1 run,dropped! Short, Gambhir top-edges his pull, and it drops into Bailey's hands at midwicket and pops back out.
Dhawan to Pandey,1 run,wristy push down to long-on.
Dhawan to Gambhir,2 runs,Gambhir gets on his toes, tucks it off his hips, behind square.
In comes Sandeep now.
Sandeep Sharma to Pandey, $$FOUR$$ ,full and straight, Pandey uses his wrists to play the pick-up shot over midwicket.
Sandeep Sharma to Pandey,2 runs,short, slower ball, Pandey mistimes his pull, and Maxwell sprinting from midwicket, underarms it at the unmanned stumps and misses, giving away two overthrows.
Sandeep Sharma to Pandey,1 run,short, flat-batted pull to deep midwicket.
Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir,2 runs,short, Gambhir swats it with an almost vertical bat to the right of deep backward square leg.
Sandeep Sharma to Gambhir,1 run,punched to cover, and Maxwell throws at the bowler's end again. He misses again, and they walk an overthrow.
One to get now.

Sandeep Sharma to Pandey,1 run,slower ball, and Pandey yells "yes, yes, yes!" as he wrists it to the right of mid-on. He sprints through, and would have probably beaten the throw, which missed the stumps anyway.

$$7.25pm$$  Presentation time. There's the merest hint of a smile on Gautam Gambhir's face as he signs the match ball and picks up the Man of the Match award. It broadens when he credits his new-born daughter for the turnaround in his fortunes.

"Robin's taken a lot of pressure of me since he started opening," he says. "On this kind of wicket, a lot of credit goes to Morne Morkel as well. Chawla bowled brilliantly, hopefully he can continue the same way."
That's it for us from this game. Thanks for tuning in, and sending in your comments. Make sure you follow our commentary for the 8.00pm game as well.

Here's Robin Uthappa: "Happy to contribute to the team's success. Gautam's instinct is to bat second, and all of us are on board with him. We knew they (Punjab) could be a little complacent, and we wanted to make use of any gaps they gave us."
Rehman: "This is the right time in the tournament to peak.There is always an outside risk if a team peaks too early in the tournament.Punjab has to be cautious."

George Bailey says "yeah, it would have been handy" when he's asked if he would have liked to have another spinner. They left out Shivam Sharma after a good performance against Bangalore, and they did look a spinner short on this pitch.

Absolutely crushing win for KKR. Kings XI never recovered after they scored only 64 in the second half of their innings. Kolkata played smart cricket during their chase, after Uthappa set them on their way with a sparkling innings at the top of the order. Gambhir made his third straight half-century, which is some comeback after starting the season with three straight ducks, and they got home with absolutely no fuss and two overs remaining.

name: Kings XI Punjab v Kolkata Knight Riders
